intro: Puebloa bradyi subsp. winkleri, commonly known as the Winkler's puebloa, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
